topic.title: Useful programs in 2019
topic.body:
Image editor: Gimp, Inkscape
Audio editors: Audacity, LMMS
Email clients: Hiri, Thunderbird
Screen-recording and Streaming Tools: Kazam, OBS
System Optimizer / Task Manager: Stacer, htop
Apps for gamers: Steam, Discord
Media player: VLC, Audacious
Media server: Kodi, Plex
Video Editor: Kdenlive, Openshot
Opensource media converter: Handbrake, Sound Converter
Backup tools: Timeshift, Bacula
PDF editing tool: Libreoffice Draw, PDF studio
Code  and text editors: VS code, Lyx, Texmaker

1_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz.body:
I started 11 years ago with Ubuntu, mandriva and OpenSuse. I kept using Ubuntu many years because the community is important and help can save time ;)
I tried Fedora in 2012 but I don't have a racing computer so the graphical effects are not good at screen. 
Lubuntu is a good OS, simple and efficient, it shares the technology of Ubuntu so everything works fine. 
I'm using Raspbian right now (the OS of Raspberry ;) ) and everything works too. It's lighter, faster and you can use it everyday ! 
Maybe you could try it and tell me you mind ;)
